experience: You and James both know Kyle Burnett, Alan Lobock, and 11 others

I am currently leading the research and development at Convrrt.Convrrt is a leading edge solution for the modern sales stack. Landing page builder (think square space), lead enrichment (think Rapportive) and data portability (think Zapier). Sales hackers are doing exactly what their name implies, hacking solutions together to make a sales stack. Our tools serve as middleware in the stack. You can you use one or you can chain them all together to create a powerful marketing automation pipeline for acquiring qualified leads and pushing them to the CRM of your choice.

I helped broker and execute a licensing deal between a company I co-founded and SharpSpring. After helping negotiate the terms of the deal I was primarily responsible for the planning, delivery and execution of the software integration into their platform. I liaisoned with their development team, managed some of their resources, implemented new features specific to their platform, and hit all required deadlines for the agreement.

I laid the foundation of a green field project and helped with building their first cloud-based product. I designed and automated their new cloud infrastructure using AWS, Mesosphere​, Docker, and DCOS for a fast and scalable platform they could deploy their application on top of.

I managed and lead the technical engineering at nutritionix. I was in charge of R&D around new technical decisions and creating MVP's to ensure that a concept would work before we put more engineering resources behind it. I designed and implemented their search API and built a system to sustain a constant flow of new nutritional information. I also did work on managing infrastructure and scaling on AWS. I worked with the team to develop a natural language parsing engine that could return nutrition information about plain text recipes.I also designed their information ingestion pipeline which allowed them to scale their data set from a few thousand verified records to over half a million. Making them the largest verified nutritional database available.
Project Manager and Full Stack Developer
Project management, Technical Lead, UX & UI Development, Information Architecture, Full Stack Development, Scale & Load Testing, Cloud Deployment

codementor.io is a place for mentors to share their knowledge of technology to help all levels of software developers get over roadblocks, learn new frameworks and languages, and give guidance to programmers of all levels. I do get paid for a majority of the work I do on code mentor however once a month I give away some of my time to help reduce the friction of being a developer.

I worked with James on a project for 6 month integration with SharpSpring. When it came time to integrate their landing page builder into the SharpSpring application I was pleasantly surprised. James made sure it was one of the easiest integrations I have ever spent time on (this is no small feat). James was capable and committed to delivering a complete package and with very few hurdles. James is a great addition to any team: a flexible, deadline-driven, and capable product manager and of course an awesome programmer.

James is not your typical software developer. He challenges the status quo daily and only works with development stacks that make sense for the project. He joined our team at the right time and single handily helped integrate Convrrt into SharpSprings platform. He is a critical thinker and no job is too big for him. He will work until the job is finished and will not take no for an answer. Working with over 30 developers in my career, I can say for the first time that I've been stress-free knowing that I have a true professional on the team that can handle any task.

Baker has been indispensable in our work at Convrrt. He came in at a critical juncture and helped us organize our final push. He helped us implement a tight user feedback based development cycle which allowed us to make enormous strides in user experience. This helped us ensure we were answering the right questions and not allowing our curse of knowledge get in the way of the customer's needs. He has a wealth of knowledge and experience and I am excited to continue working with him.

summary: I am a dedicated life-long learner and early adopter of technology. If it contains bits, bytes I want to reverse engineer it. I pride myself in being as efficient as possible, and I am always looking for new leading edge ways to improve my workflow and technical skills.Though my biggest passion is technology, I am a musician and a music buff. The first thing you will notice is I always have my headphones in.I am eager to continue learning, adopting, teaching, and leading.
